'[[Candy]]' has a long history as a familiar food treat that is available in
many varieties. Candy is also referred to as sweets or confectionary. Candy
varieties are influenced by the size of the sugar crystals, aeration, sugar
concentrations, colour and the types of sugar used. [http://www.candyhelp.com/candy_sugar_confectionary.html Candy
Product Suger Confectionery ] Jelly candies,
such as gumdrops and gummies, use stabilizers including starch, pectin or
gelatin. Simple sugar or sucrose is turned into candy by
dissolving it in water, concentrating this solution through cooking and allowing
the mass either to form a mutable solid or to recrystallize. Other sugars, sugar substitutes, and corn syrup are also
used. Another type of candy is cotton candy, which is made from spun sugar.
